info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 19 at 3:01AM CDT until September 19 at 3:15AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM CDT FOR EASTERN HANCOCK AND SOUTHWESTERN MCDONOUGH COUNTIES... At 301 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Bentley, or near Carthage, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. Locations impacted include... Carthage, Colchester, Augusta, Bowen, Ferris, Tennessee, Adrian, Fandon, Burnside, Colmar, Plymouth, Denver, Fountain Green, Bentley, Webster and Hancock County Fairgrounds. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
